result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chanel R. Chatham

records.addlTxt: 01:58 PM Defendant Chanel R. Chatham not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin appeared by phone means. Defendant appeared on 4/5, was in school and asked for an adjourned appearance for today and she fails to appear.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:11 PM Defendant Chanel R. Chatham appeared by zoom technology by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  At your last hearing you indicated you were retaining Attorney Nelson.  Ms. Chatham wants to waive time limits for PH.  She's currently in school and ask for a little bit more time, 60 days if allowed.  You waived time limits on 1/24.  Defendant continues to waive time limits for PH.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:29 PM Defendant Chanel R. Chatham appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Chatham previously appeared and was given time to speak to an attorney.  Defendant in the process of getting Aaron Nelson hired and need more time.  If you engage Mr. Nelson's services, he will know how to change the date if it doesn't work for him.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 01:57 PM Defendant Chanel R. Chatham appeared by video means from the Pepin County Jail.   Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges in the complaint/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  State informs Ms. Chatham has no criminal record, she's a resident of MN, this is a serious matter as a PTAC and think $2500 signature bond appropriate.  Any conditions Mr. Seifert?  Return to court, not possess or consume any controlled substance.  Court will release you on $2500 signature bond with conditions: refrain from posses or consume controlled substance without a physician's prescription; refrain from possess or consume alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns.  Court advises of right to preliminary hearing.  If you want it in 20 days we will give it to you but likely wouldn't have counsel.  Ms. Chatham wishes to wait until she has counsel.  Court finds she knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waives time limits for PH.  Contact the PD office to determine eligibility and if not eligible the Court would be willing to appoint counsel for you.  Defendant confirms her address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
